page.title: 02EDUCATION IN ONGAR
page.content: {ONGAR JUNIOR AND INFANTS SCHOOL Chipping Ongar Junior School was erected in 1968.The Juniors and Infants have just been combined to form one school.162 chidren go the Junior half and 143 go to the Infants half.The school covers an area of 850 square metres. It employs 30 people, including the headmaster and eleven teachers.The age range is from 5 to 11 years old and all the classes are of mixed ability. {GREAT STONY SCHOOL Great Stony School was built in 1905 for orphans, but it is now used for children with special needs from the Greater London area.The age range is from 5 to 16. About 130 people are employed and the school has 140 pupils.It also has groups for Scouts, Cubs, Brownies and Guides .The school is run by{ILEA.
